Sentencas: Carbon deposition is an issue when operating solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) on fuels other than hydrogen, and so a variety of strategies have been used to prevent carbon accumulation on the anodes.
Titulo: Evaluation of a Cu/YSZ and Ni/YSZ Bilayer Anode for the Direct Utilization of Methane in a Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: In this paper, we describe a bilayer anode that contains a functional layer consisting of Ni/YSZ and a conduction layer consisting of Cu/YSZ.
Titulo: Evaluation of a Cu/YSZ and Ni/YSZ Bilayer Anode for the Direct Utilization of Methane in a Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The anode-supported button cells were fabricated using a uni-axially pressing technique to produce the anode, followed by impregnation with Cu.
Titulo: Evaluation of a Cu/YSZ and Ni/YSZ Bilayer Anode for the Direct Utilization of Methane in a Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The cells were tested at 1,023K in dry CH4 and their performance compared to that of a typical Ni/YSZ anode.
Titulo: Evaluation of a Cu/YSZ and Ni/YSZ Bilayer Anode for the Direct Utilization of Methane in a Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The Cu does not catalyze the cracking of methane and as such less carbon deposits in the conduction layer resulting in anode stability for over 100h.
Titulo: Evaluation of a Cu/YSZ and Ni/YSZ Bilayer Anode for the Direct Utilization of Methane in a Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The limitation with using Cu in the anode is the temperature of operation.
Titulo: Evaluation of a Cu/YSZ and Ni/YSZ Bilayer Anode for the Direct Utilization of Methane in a Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell
